title: Fat Script Typeface
content:
Hi All, I'm looking for a typeface or two that are similar to the typefaces used in the attached logos.

I'm not looking for an exact match, just something similar.

Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [split.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/typophile.com/files/split.gif) | 29.8 KB |
author: khayden

comments.content:
[Motter Femina](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=SG.1608.0.0)  
 [Stilla](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=SG.2399.0.0)  
 [Mousse Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000162)  
 [Mr Sheppards](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000081)  
 [Kolinsky Sable](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/kolinsky-sable/?refby=typographica)  
 [Ballpark Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/letterheadfonts.com/contributors/tomkennedy/ballpark.shtml)  
 [Philly Sport Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UR.109967.0.0)  
 [Funky Chunk](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/funky-chunk-nf/?refby=typographica)  
 [Varga](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.2740.0.0)  
 [Octopuss](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=SG.102057.0.0)(y)

Sorry, this is what happens when I don't have to find an exact match. Hope there's something in there you like.

' [Amazing Grace](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.signdna.com/v2/cart/product.php?cat_id=35&gp=&prod_id=118)', ' [Bello](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=bello&id2=script)', ' [Bernhard Brushscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/bernhard-brushscript-sg/)', ' [Brushwacker](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/artandsignstudio.com/brushwacker.html)', ' [Futura Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=EFT0000189)', ' [Geetype](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000005)', ' [Happy Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.signdna.com/v2/cart/product.php?cat_id=35&gp=&prod_id=55)', ' [Jolly Roger](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=RRT0011505)', ' [Juicy](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=832&dw=2801)', ' [Kari](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000155)', ' [Milkman](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/mikeerickson/milkman.shtml)', ' [Motherlode](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/artandsignstudio.com/motherlode.html)', ' [Rhino](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/artandsignstudio.com/rhino.html)'..

_\> [www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/52890.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/66.249.93.104/search?q=cache:yr0_Qe0PgQsJ:www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/52890.html%3F1099749993+%22fat+scripts%22+site:typophile.com&hl=en) ( Google 'Cached' )  
\> [typophile.com/node/7525](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/typophile.com/node/7525) ( Archived thread, missing several posts )_

_\* Edit-A-Bit.: I think the originally posted 'Split' logotypes have been designed by fellow Typophile beejay.. :)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524004558/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Thanks everyone, some great fonts suggestions from all, it's much appreciated.

My favorite by the way is Bello. Of course it's the most expensive... my wife always says I'm "high maintenance" and I guess this just prooves her point. But it's such a gorgeous face.

Again, thanks everyone!
